recipeDescriptionLines.recipeDescriptionLine: Groundnut or Peanut Chutney is a simple and quick chutney that is made with roasted peanuts and served as a condiment and best enjoyed with idlis, dosas, utthappam, vadas , upma and sometimes with pakodas.
Peanuts are rich in nutrients, such as vitamin E, fiber, niacin, magnesium and many others.
This chutney  can be prepared in number of ways, below is one of them

procedureSteps.stepDescription: Dry roast groundnut on low flame for 7-8 mins. Keep it aside. In the same pan, add 1 tbsp oil, fry garlic for 10 secs. Then add groundnuts and fry for 2 mins. Allow it to cool down.
Grind the above with chillies, tamarind juice, salt and 1/2 cup water into a smooth paste. Add more water based on the required thickness.
For seasoning, heat oil, add mustard seeds, allow it to splutter. Add curry leaves. Add the seasoning to groundnut paste. Chutney is ready to be served with dosa , vadas.

tips.tipDesc: You can use green chillies instead of dry red chillies. Just fry them in oil along with garlic.
